page.title: 09TOURISM IN PLOCKTON.
page.content: LOTS OF TOURISTS COME TO PLOCKTON,A NATIONAL TRUST FOR SCOTLAND VILLAGE, BECAUSE IT IS ATTRACTIVE AND PEACEFUL. MOST OF THE TOURISTS ARE AMAZED TO SEE THAT{PALM TREES}GROW HERE.ACROSS THE BAY IS{DUNCRAIG CASTLE,}WHICH IS USED AS A COLLEGE.TOURISTS TRAVEL ON THE KYLE LINE BECAUSE IT IS SO SCENIC. THERE ARE 5 PLACES TO STAY FOR{BED AND {BREAKFAST}AND 3{HOTELS.}THERE IS A {CAMPSITE}AT FRITHARD ROAD WHICH CAN HOLD UP TO 10 CARAVANS AND 37 TENTS. THE CAMPSITE HAS GOOD FACILITIES,LIKE A SHOP,LAUNDRETTE,SHOWERS AND WATER. AT DUIRINISH THERE ARE 5 SELF CATERING {CHALETS}WHICH LOOK LIKE LOG CABINS. TOURISTS LIKE TAKING AND PAINTING PICTURES,HAVING PICNICS AND GOING OUT IN BOATS OR CANOES.THE MONEY SPENT BY THE SUMMER VISITORS IS IMPORTANT FOR THE{LIVELIHOOD}OF THE{STORES,3 CRAFT {SHOPS,LEISURE MARINE AND THE 3 HOTELS.
